article_title: Saturday letters: Beyoncé 101, Ted Cruz, Confederate names
article_text: To continue reading this story, you will need to be a digital subscriber to HoustonChronicle.com.

article_metadata.description: Instead of recommending ways to improve the Affordable Care Act and help strengthen America's health care system, Cruz has consistently promised to repeal the law in its entirety if elected president.  Regarding "Crazy college courses" (Page B8, Wednesday), the letter writer condemns the Beyoncé course touted by its creator in "The academic perils of a class on Beyoncé" (Page B7, Jan. 8).  [...] yes, might I offer that I'd bet there are whole college courses, or portions of them, that teach these and other pop culture icons.  Just because Beyoncé is young and vibrant and wiggles her hips, we shouldn't dismiss her mind and her creativity - even if our generation is in that category where young folks look at us and think we're ancient.
article_metadata.author.name: Copyright 2016: Houston Chronicle
